name: Cinchona officinalis
Relationship: Compare: QUINIDINE - (Paroxysmal tachycardia and AURICULAR FIBRILLATION. Heart is slowed, and the auriculoventricular conduction time is lengthened. Dose 1/2 grain t.i.d. CEPHALANTHUS - Button Bush - Intermittent fever, sore throat, rheumatic symptoms, vivid dreams). ARS.; CEDRON.; NAT-SULPH. CYDONIA VULGARIS - Quince (supposed to be of use to strengthen the sexual organs and stomach).Complementary: FERRUM; CALC. PHOS.Antidotes: ARN.; ARS.; NUX; IPEC.
Modalities: Better: bending double; hard pressure; open air; warmth

Stool: Undigested, frothy, yellow; painless; worse at night, after meals, during hot weather, from fruit, milk, beer
Head: Intense throbbing of head and carotids
As if skull would burst
Face flushed after hemorrhages, or sexual excesses, or loss of vital fluids
Relieved from pressure and warm room
Aches worse in open air, from temple to temple
Worse by contact, current of air, stepping
Sensation as if brain were balancing to and fro, and striking against skull, receiving great pain
Spasmodic headache in vertex, with subsequent pain, as if bruised in sides of head
Dizzy when walking
Scalp sensitive; worse combing hair
Fever: Intermittent, paroxysms anticipate; return every week
Hay fever, watery coryza, pain in temples
Free perspiration caused by every little exertion, especially on single parts
Chill generally in forenoon, commencing in breast; thirst before chill, and little and often
Stomach: Flatulence; belching of bitter fluid or regurgitation of food gives no relief; worse eating fruit
Darting pain crosswise in hypogastric region
Hungry longing for food, which lies undigested
Abdomen: Internal coldness of stomach and abdomen
Liver and spleen swollen and enlarged
Much flatulent colic; better bending double
Mouth: Tongue coated thick, dirty; tip burns, succeeded by ptyalism
Toothache; better pressing teeth firmly together, and by warmth
Respiratory: Suffocative catarrh; rattling in chest; violent, hacking cough after every meal
Dyspnoea, sharp pain in left lung
Eyes: Black specks, bright dazzling illusions; night blindness in anaemic retina
Nose: Easily bleeding from nose, especially on rising
Male: Frequent emissions, followed by great weakness
Heart: Irregular with weak rapid beats followed by strong, heart beats
Suffocative attacks, syncope; anaemia and dropsy
Mind: Disposition to hurt other peoples' feelings
Ideas crowd in mind; prevent sleep
Back: Sharp pains across kidneys, worse movement and at night
Sleep: Anxious, frightful dreams with confused consciousness on waking, so that the dream cannot be rid of and fear of dream remains
Female: Seems to take the place of the usual menstrual discharge
Skin: One hand ice cold, the other warm
Indurated glands; scrofulous ulcers and caries
Extreme sensitiveness to touch, but hard pressure relieves
Extremities: Great debility trembling, with numb sensation
Averse to exercise; sensitive to touch
Sensation as of a string around limb
Weariness of joints; worse, mornings and when sitting
Pains in limbs and joints, as if sprained; worse, slight touch; hard pressure relieves
Joints swollen; very sensitive, with dread or open air

details: DEBILITY from exhausting discharges, from loss of vital fluids, together with a NERVOUS ERETHISM, calls for this remedy. Periodicity is most marked. Sensitive to drafts. Seldom indicated in the earlier stages of acute disease. Chronic gout. Chronic suppurative pyelitis. Post operative gas pains, no relief from passing it.
